cab.content: From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,1th May 1919. '(Received.8th at 0.15 a.m.)6241. 7th April. North-West Frontier. Reference Foreign and Political Departments reports ending with No. 574- of 6th May. Military steps taken include : (a) Despatch of mobile column to Landi Kotal in support of KhyberMilitia.(b) Despatch of mobile column to Parachinar in support of KuramMilitia.(c) Issue of orders for mobilisation and concentration of field army andmobile brigades, and formation of two British infantry brigades from demobilised, and of four Indian infantry brigades from unallotted units.(d) Despatcli on 7tli May of British battalion of 1st Brigade, 1st Divi-sion, with two guns, to Landi Kotal. Remainder of brigade with guns and cavalry follow, arriving 8th May. Second brigade to follow to Jamrucl in support. Third brigade concentrating at Peshawar.(e) Despatch on 7th May of one cavalry brigade to Shahgai on MalagoriRoad.
